source.0201f120:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
source.53ce0ca1:
vals = census.drop(['caseid'], axis=1).values
census_cluster = KMeans(n_clusters=5)
census_cluster.fit(vals)

labs = census_cluster.labels_
centroids = census_cluster.cluster_centers_
source.bf1b8178: centroid_df = pd.DataFrame(columns = census.drop(['caseid'], axis=1).columns, data = centroids)
source.5acd02e5: ### Centroids 0, 3,and 4 are very similar, and appear to represent older adults. The age, number of working years, and disability status are all relatively high in these centroids
